description: birth to 12  months

description: 4 to 12 years

description: scaled for a toy figure

description: to fit a newborn baby

description: to fit a premature baby

description: 1 to 3 years
measurements of garment are  smaller than the corresponding body measurements, creating a snugger  fit
measurements of  the garment are the same as corresponding body measurments
measurements of the garment are  larger than corresponding body measurements
fits close to the body
extra length and extra width/room is added to the waist to  accomodate a pregnant person's stomach
designed to fit small-scale items
large amount of positive ease used as a design element.
contains instructions for size XS and smaller
contains instructions for size XL and larger
contains instructions for taller individuals
Usually used or worn by females
Usually used or worn by males
Used or worn by anyone
a two-color ribbing in which the knits are worked in one color and the purls in a second color.
a knitting and crochet technique that produces an hidden image that is only viewable from an angle.
colorwork technique used to create separate blocks of color and in which each area of color has its own separate length of yarn.
colorwork technique in which the color pattern is made by slipping stitches, with only one color is worked on each row.
multi-color knitting with all yarn used in the row/round carried across the back of the work.
Alternating sections of two or more colors
a garment that is fitted around one point, most commonly the shoulders or the waist, and gradually widens out toward the hem giving the impression of a capital letter A.
fabric has a smaller ornament or embellishment applied to its surface for decoration.
designed to be unbalanced on ppposite sides of the finished object.
utilizes some type of closure at the back of a garment or piece.
embellished with beads or pailettes.
a style of please that is actually two pleats facing opposite directions to make a flat surface between pleats; can be reversible.
embellished or fastened with buttons or something button-like.
a yoke with a rounded look which integrates shoulder and neck, with shaping spread evenly around circumference.
designed to be changed from one style to another.
shortened or clipped in length.
a decrease/increase along a line which creates shaping.
fastened by overlapping one edge of the front over the other, usually with a double row of buttons.
embellishment technique using a second yarn (often of a contrasting color) and tapestry needle to create a design on a piece of fabric by working over existing stitches.
surface embellishment worked on the finished piece using a thread/string/yarn and tapestry needle.
waist shaping (seamed or not) that falls just under the bustline.
pieces of material that are folded back & inside, usually at the edges of a garment but sometimes over a seam.
Decorative edging consisting of lengths of yarn or fabric attached at one end to the work.
utilizes some type of closure at the front of a garment or piece.
small fold or pucker made by gathering fabric together.
An edge finish that consists of a folded back edge that is then fastened down.
A covering for the head and neck.
has a material or fabric that covers all or part of the inner surface of the garment or item.
has a v-shaped cut or indentation.
a short flared, ruffled, or gathered, strip attached to the waistline of a garment to create a frill or flounce.
a series of small, ornamental looped shapes which form a decorate edge or embellishment to fabric.
a back treatment for sleeveless garments which is formed by extra deep armholes or straps that meet at a narrow back.
fabric that is significantly wider at one edge than the opposite edge, resulting in a frilled or flounced appearance.
having fastenings on the shoulders.
coat, jacket, cardigan or vest with a single row of buttons.  Front pieces usually only overlap for the width of the button band.
enclosures or fasteners for a garment that are made up of two pieces that fit into one another and snap together to secure the two pieces of the garment.
without shaping
Alternating sections of two or more colors or textures.
an exagerrated, loosely flared shape, usually on a coat or jacket.
a dangling decorative trim or adornment consisting of a bunch of cords fastened at one end.
fastened with tied cords/strings.
shaping in the waist area in order to give the garment a  defined waist.
garment that folds around the body.
item is fastened or embellished with a zipper.
An extra length of fabric that is attached to the neck opening of a garment.
A short standing collar that is separated by a gap at the front and/or back.  Also called a Nehru collar.
a small flat collar that is rounded at the front.
a collar or edge treatment to for a neck that is closely rolled and and very short.
a wide, turned-over collar of a garment that combines with lapels forming an unbroken curving line.
short folded collar that opens in the middle and has pointed ends. Sometimes fastens with buttons.
an edge that is added to a piece using a crochet hook.
An edge to that is added to fabric (applied either during the construction or after, during finishing) made of a narrow tube worked in stockinette.
an edge of an item that includes open work in knitted or crocheted lace
a high, wide scoop neck.
a neckline created when two rectangles are sewn together (sometimes overlapping) leaving an unshaped opening in the middle.
a loose-fitting, draped, turned-over neckline.
a round neckline that is close to the neck.
a neckline/collar that is worked as an extension of the body and usually extends a short distance.
a neckline with straps, bands, or ties that wrap around and connect at the nape of the neck.
a neckline treatment with a placket (usually buttoned) and round neck, with a band or no collar.
a neckline with a rounded opening which closes at the top.
a tube neck, shorter than a turtleneck, generally with no foldover.
a low rounded neckline. aan be almost as short as a crew neck or very deep.
a neckline that has distinct corners in the front, with parallel side edges.
a cross over necklin which can be constructed as a wrap front garment or as a single front with one layer of the neckline under the other.
a rounded v-neck which creates a shape like a heart.
a tall rolled or folded collar, which is called turtleneck in the US, polo neck in the UK.
a neckline with straight sides that meet at a pointed bottom.
a pocket added after the garment is completed
has another type of pocket incorporated into the design not included in the list
a pocket in the garment seam that isn't readily visible
a pocket made from a separate piece that's sewn on
a pocket whose opening is knitted into the body of a garment
a sleeve that ends halfway between the wrist bone and the elbow.
not sleeveless.
sleeve ends slightly above the wrist bone.
a very short sleeve style which covers the top of shoulder and usually has little or no length at the underarm.
a technique where the shoulder seams and sleeve caps of a garment are worked from the top down.
sleeve has a cuff, fold, or band that serves as the trim or finish to the bottom.
a sleeve usually formed integrally with the front and back with a deep armhole starting low on the body; often shaped like a large triangle tapering at the wrist.
a shoulder seam that extends beyond the natural shoulder edge and usually creates a wider fitting sleeve.
sleeve ends at the elbow
a short, loose sleeve that falls in folds over the upper arm.
sleeve ends at the wrist bone or later
a drop sleeve with minimal shaping at the armpit to reduce fabric bulk.
diagonal armhole shaping running from the underarm to the middle of the sleeve. Reverse shaping to Raglan.
sleeves with extra fullness at the shoulder, generally gathered or pleated at the top of the armhole seam and again in a band at the sleeve bottom.
diagonal armhole shaping, running from the underarm to the neckline.
a sleeve with a narrow strip that extends to the neckline which creates two shoulder seams rather than one.
armhole shaping like that on a 'traditional' dress or buttondown shirt.  A scooped shape at the underarm extending in a straight line up to the shoulder.
a sleeve that ends above the elbow.
a garment that is without any sort of sleeve
a sleeve, usually short or cap, consisting of two layers that overlap at the outside of the arm like the shape of petals of a tulip.
a set of stitches forming a raised bump

Fabric with tucked stitches (yarn overs that are knitted together with a slipped stitch from the previous row). Such stitches may also be made by knitting into the row below and dropping the stitch above.
crossing one set of stitches over another
A  stitch pattern that causes the fabric to make zigzags.
knit stitches that are dropped and allowed to unravel producing open, vertical stripes in the fabric
fabric that easily returns to its original shape after being stretched
a fabric that incorporates yarn overs to create a hole used for  either aesthetic or funtional purposes
a pattern of stable holes that are arranged to create a decorative fabric
a simple, open fabric resembling netting
Both sides of  the fabric are attractive enough to be considered the "right" side
fabric creating a vertically ridged pattern
a horizontal undulating wave pattern.
in knitting, stitches moved from one needle to  the other without being worked; in crochet, stitiches used when a crochet stitch doesn't need added height
fabric gathered at certain locations to bring in, or reduce width or height
A mix of stitches providing surface interest
Stitches worked so the legs are  crossed
stuffed animals and anthropomorphic creatures made in a style of crochet and knitting originating in Japan.
using construction techniques and/or colorwork motifs derived from Peru and/or the Andean mountains of South America.
a style of work that includes intricate designs using cables, bobbles and other decorative elements that originated in the Aran Islands of Ireland.
A style of textured knitting employing twisted stitches, traveling stitches, and narrow cables.
colorwork sweaters, usually featuring distinctive shawl collars and made with bulky yarns and in geometric and bird/animal motifs traditionally done by the Canadian Cowichan First Nations people.
regional knitting style from Denmark - textured patterning worked in knits and purls.
regional style of stranded colorwork or detailed, textured lace from Estonia.
stranded colorwork specific to the Fair Isle and Shetland regions of Scotland using no more than two colors per row, limited color runs, and featuring distictive color banding.
created with traditional techniques from the Faroe Islands, most often lace shawls with special shaping in the shoulders and a back gusset.
traditional colorwork and lace designs created with techniques and motifs originating in Finland.
traditional knitting, often of seamans' sweaters, developed on the Channel Island of Guernsey. Sweaters often feature a raised shoulder seam, underam gussets and a split at the hem.
stranded colorwork or lace patterns (often circular-yoke Lopi sweaters or lace shawls which can be multi-colored) created with traditional Icelandic techniques and motifs.
knitting or crochet created with techniques traditionally from Ireland. Often includes richly cabled garments (knitting) or floral/lace motifs (crochet).
techniques derived from the various regions of the Baltic state of Latvia, often used in mittens
a variety of stranded colorwork, often two colors but sometimes three or more in a single row
very fine geometric lace originating in Orenburg, Russia
created with techniques from the indigenous Sámi people of Scandinavia and European Russia
very fine, traditional geometric lace or Fair Isle colorwork originating in the Shetland Islands.
distinct styles of garment shaping and patterning originating in Sweden, including Bohus styes and Tvåändsstickning, or twined knitting.
created with techniques traditionally from Turkey, often a form of colorwork featuring diagonal lines & geometric patterns
an object that has height, width and depth
a shape where all the edges are the same distance from a central point
the shape produced when a circle has a segment of another circle removed from its edge
three dimensional figure made of six squares
half of a circle as divided by diameter
six-sided shape
eight-sided shape
egg shaped
five-sided shape
three dimensional figure made of four triangles
four-sided with opposite sides of equal length, adjacent sides are at 90 degree  angles to each other
three dimensional figure all points of which are equidistant from a fixed point
four-sided with all sides of equal length, adjacent sides are at 90 degree angles to  each other
shaped like a star
three-sided shape
